summary: Completed testing of mobile drag-and-drop functionality for SpeedShield PWA. Found that drag controls appear correctly when tapping speedometer, but actual dragging is blocked by notification overlays. Position persistence and restoration work correctly.

ui_bugs.issue: Notification overlays (GPS error messages) block drag interactions
ui_bugs.details: Toast notifications with GPS error messages intercept pointer events, preventing drag gestures from working

integration_issues.issue: Drag gesture blocked by overlay elements
integration_issues.details: While drag controls appear correctly, actual dragging is prevented by notification overlays

passed_tests: Mobile drag controls - Tap on speedometer shows drag controls (lock/unlock button and 'DRAG' handle)
Mobile drag controls - Lock/unlock button is visible with proper styling
Mobile drag controls - Drag handle with 'Drag' text is visible and properly positioned
Mobile drag controls - Controls have proper opacity transition (opacity-100 when shown)
localStorage persistence - Position data is saved to 'speedHudPosition' key
localStorage persistence - Position data updates when component moves
Position restoration - Component position is restored correctly after page reload
Position restoration - localStorage data persists across browser sessions
Mobile viewport - App loads correctly on mobile viewport (390x844)
Mobile viewport - Speedometer component is properly positioned and visible
Touch target sizing - Drag handle meets iOS minimum touch target (44px height)
Visual feedback - Controls show proper styling and transitions

success_percentage.frontend: 75% (drag controls work, but dragging blocked by overlays)

action_item_for_main_agent: Fix notification overlay interference with drag functionality. The GPS error notifications are blocking pointer events on the drag handle. Consider: 1) Adding z-index management for drag controls, 2) Dismissing notifications when drag starts, or 3) Adjusting notification positioning to avoid drag areas.
